issue.title: Google invaild search result

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

4.1.53

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Dangerous site

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

Many websites

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, List-KR

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

In Google search result with a Korean language query, there are some spam websites that its domain is changed frequently.


It seems that importing the following rules is best idea.

```adblock
/^https:\/\/[A-z0-9\.]*[A-z0-9]+\.[A-z]+\/\?u=[A-z0-9]{7}&o=[A-z0-9]{7}/$document
/^https:\/\/[A-z]+\.[A-z]+\.[A-z]+\/[A-z]+-robot\/\?pl=[A-z0-9-]{22}&sm=[A-z]+-robot&hash=[A-z0-9-]{22}&exp=[0-9]{10}/$document
/^https:\/\/[0-9]{9}\.[A-z0-9-]+\.[A-z]{2}\/[0-9]{6}\.html$/$document
```

Related issues:
 - https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/issues/598
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/139667

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
Or, expand feature of AdGuard Browsing Security module to support a regexp rule.
@ameshkov

issue.title: Google invaild search result

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

4.1.53

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Dangerous site

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

Many websites

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, List-KR

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

In Google search result with a Korean language query, there are some spam websites that its domain is changed frequently.


It seems that importing the following rules is best idea.

```adblock
/^https:\/\/[A-z0-9\.]*[A-z0-9]+\.[A-z]+\/\?u=[A-z0-9]{7}&o=[A-z0-9]{7}/$document
/^https:\/\/[A-z]+\.[A-z]+\.[A-z]+\/[A-z]+-robot\/\?pl=[A-z0-9-]{22}&sm=[A-z]+-robot&hash=[A-z0-9-]{22}&exp=[0-9]{10}/$document
/^https:\/\/[0-9]{9}\.[A-z0-9-]+\.[A-z]{2}\/[0-9]{6}\.html$/$document
```

Related issues:
 - https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/issues/598
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/139667

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
For performance reason, a filter maintainer avoids to commonly add a regexp rule.
However, if it is necessary for many internet users, I think that it is worth adding it unless It occurs a ReDoS event.

To verify that a regexp rule does not occur a ReDoS event, I develop [List-KR/check-regex](https://github.com/List-KR/check-regex) slowly.
